title: Jilted man in “throuple” spared jail for slashing his love rival with saw
text:

A jilted man slashed his love rival across the face with a saw after they came to blows outside their girlfriend's home, a court heard.

Adrian Webster and Desmond McAuliffe were both romantiacally involved in a throuple with Amy Coleman.

Webster, 51, attacked Mr McAuliffe after having a fight outside her home in Wellesbourne, Warkwickshire.

On May 5 last year Webster was with Ms Coleman, when she popped out to meet Mr McAuliffe at her local pub.

Hours later the pair returned to her home where Webster was and the men started arguing.

Warwick Crown Court heard Mr McAuliffe ran towards Webster, who was holding a saw he was going to sell on eBay, and slashed him in the face.

On Friday Webster, of Stratford-upon-Avon, was sentenced to 10 months in prison, suspended for 12 months, after admitting unlawful wounding.

(Image: Paul Beard / SWNS)

He was also ordered to do 120 hours of unpaid work and pay £300 court costs.

Judge Peter Cooke said the attack was “excessive self-defence”, adding: “It was a single blow in an isolated incident by a man of previous good character.

“I am dealing with you in a way which is entirely faithful to your plea. There was an element of provocation to which you were responding.

“You do not represent a risk of danger to the public.

“You are someone who has already taken stock of matters and conducted himself sensibly in the 17 months that have gone by.”

“I am not going to make a compensation order. I am mindful that Mr McAuliffe came looking for you for a confrontation."

The court heard Webster had been in an “on-off” relationship with Ms Coleman for 13 years and was aware she was also seeing Mr McAuliffe.

(Image: Paul Beard / SWNS)

Prosecutor Tim Sapwell said: “The two men were both romantically involved with Amy Coleman.

“On May 5 last year she and Webster were at her home in Baker Drive, Wellesbourne, but Ms Coleman then went out, having arranged to meet Mr McAuliffe in a pub.

“The defendant was aware of this, because she had told him this was what was going to happen.

“She remembers Mr McAuliffe going for the defendant with his fist and the defendant hitting back.”

“When Mr McAuliffe came running towards me he went to hit me with his fist, and I tried to push him away, but I still had the saw in my hand.”

Mr McAuliffe was slashed across the face with the saw, causing a 12cm wound and a detachment to his nasal septum, and the police were called.

Webster went to Leamington Spa police station to hand himself in, taking the saw with him to give to the police.

Jane Brady, defending, said: “He didn’t mean to do what he had done. There was some provocation from Mr McAuliffe by going to the address to confront him.”
description: Adrian Webster, of Stratford-upon-Avon, was sentenced to 10 months in prison, suspended for 12 months, after admitting unlawful wounding
